datafield.subfield: Exact phase space matching for staging plasma and traditional accelerator components using longitudinally tailored plasma profiles
Coherent phase space matching for staging plasma and traditional accelerator using longitudinally tailored plasma structure
Exact phase space matching for staging plasma and traditional accelerator components using longitudinally tailored plasma profiles

Phase space matching between two plasma-accelerator (PA) stages and between a PA and a traditional accelerator component is a critical issue for emittance preservation of beams accelerated by PAs. The drastic differences of the transverse focusing strengths as the beam propagates between different stages and components may lead to a catastrophic emittance growth in the presence of both finite energy spread and lack of proper matching. We propose using the linear focusing forces from nonlinear wakes in longitudinally tailored plasma density profiles to provide exact phase space matching to properly transport the electron beam through two such stages with negligible emittance growth. Theoretical analysis and particle-in-cell simulations show how these structures may work in four different scenarios. Good agreement between theory and simulation is obtained.

00000 Configurations of different stages. (a) plasma based injector and PA; (b) RF-based injector and PA; (c) PA and undulator; (d) PAs. The yellow quadrupole represents the traditional beam transport.

00001 The phase space and emittance evolution of an electron beam from a high density plasma injector ($10^{19}~\centi\meter^{-3}$) with $\left\langle \gamma _b \right \rangle = 200, \hat{\sigma}_E=0.01$. It drifts 0.5 $\milli\meter$ in vacuum and then propagates in a low density plasma accelerator ($10^{17}~\centi\meter^{-3}$). The $x-p_x$ phase space at (a) $z=0\milli\meter$, (b) $z=12.5\milli\meter$ and (c) $z=200\milli\meter$. The color represents the energy. (d) The emittance evolution under different acceleration gradients (normalized in $mc\omega_{p,acc}/e$).

00004 (a) The configuration of the matching plasma between the PA and the quadrupoles. (b) The plasma and beam density distributions at $z=0~\milli\meter$ and $z=13.3~\milli\meter$. (c) The $x-p_x$ phase space plots at $z=0~\milli\meter$ and $z=13.3~\milli\meter$. (d) The emittance, $\beta$ function and $\alpha$ function evolutions of the electron beam in the matching plasma. The parameters of the electron beam at $z=0~\milli\meter$ are: $\sigma_{x,y} = 0.34~\micro\meter, \tau_{FWHM} = 25~\femto\second, \left\langle \gamma_b \right \rangle = 4000, \hat{\sigma}_E = 0.05, n_b = 10^{18}~\centi\meter^{-3}$. The parameters of the 800 $\nano\meter$ laser are: $a_0=3, w_0=2\sqrt{a_0}c/\omega_{p,acc} = 58~\micro\meter, \tau_{FWHM} = 100~\femto\second$. The laser is focused at $z=0~\milli\meter$. The energy of the beam varies from from $\left\langle \gamma_b \right \rangle = 4000, \hat{\sigma}_E = 0.05$ at $z=0~\milli\meter$ to $\left\langle \gamma_b \right \rangle = 3966.6, \hat{\sigma}_E = 0.0506$ at $z=13.3~\milli\meter$.

00003 (a) The configuration of the matching plasma between the RF-based accelerator and the PA. (b) The plasma and beam density distributions at $z=-5.8~\milli\meter$ and $z=0~\milli\meter$. (c) The $x-p_x$ phase space plots at $z=-5.8~\milli\meter$ and $z=0~\milli\meter$. (d) The emittance, $\beta$ function and $\alpha$ function evolutions of the electron beam in the matching plasma. The parameters of the electron beam at $z=-5.8~\milli\meter$ are: $\sigma_{x,y} = 10.9~\micro\meter, \tau_{FWHM} = 25~\femto\second, \left\langle \gamma_b \right \rangle = 50, \hat{\sigma}_E = 0.02, n_b = 10^{16}~\centi\meter^{-3}$. The parameters of the 800 $\nano\meter$ laser are: $a_0=3, w_0=2\sqrt{a_0}c/\omega_{p,acc} = 58~\micro\meter, \tau_{FWHM} = 100~\femto\second$. The laser is focused at $z=0~\milli\meter$. The energy of the beam varies from from $\left\langle \gamma_b \right \rangle = 50, \hat{\sigma}_E = 0.02$ at $z=-5.8~\milli\meter$ to $\left\langle \gamma_b \right \rangle = 44.8, \hat{\sigma}_E = 0.0225$ at $z=0~\milli\meter$.

00002 (a) The configuration of the matching plasma between plasma based injector and PA. (b) The plasma and beam density distributions at $z=0~\milli\meter$ and $z=0.39~\milli\meter$. (c) The $x-p_x$ phase space plots at $z=0~\milli\meter$ and $z=0.39~\milli\meter$. (d) The emittance, $\beta$ function and $\alpha$ function evolutions of the electron beam in the matching plasma. The parameters of the electron beam at $z=0~\milli\meter$ are: $\sigma_{x,y} = 0.17~\micro\meter, \tau_{FWHM} = 5~\femto\second, \left\langle \gamma_b \right\rangle = 200, \hat{\sigma}_E = 0.1, n_b = 10^{20}~\centi\meter^{-3}$. The parameters of the 800 $\nano\meter$ laser are: $a_0=4, w_0= 10~\micro\meter, \tau_{FWHM}= 15~\femto\second$. The laser is focused at $z=-0.04~\milli\meter$. The energy of the beam varies from from $\left\langle \gamma_b \right \rangle = 200, \hat{\sigma}_E = 0.1$ at $z=0~\milli\meter$ to $\left\langle \gamma_b \right \rangle = 192, \hat{\sigma}_E = 0.105$ at $z=0.39~\milli\meter$.
